messages.subject: Moving to groups.io
messages.msgSnippet: I ve strted the process of requestion that groups.io import the members and content of this group. It won t happen quickly; there s a queue and a backlog. The
messages.messageBody:
I've strted the process of requestion that groups.io import the members and content of this group.  


It won't happen quickly; there's a queue and a backlog. 


The cost will be $220 a year (so... $18.33 a month).  I did pay for the first year, but did NOT opt to pay the extra $200 for them to expedite us.  Here's why that's okay:


A dad in this group has already secured the archives.  (Thank you, Vlad!) So if that full-group transfer fails, the older posts will still be available.  I've seen the format.  It's way nicer and easier to read than yahoogroups ever was. :-)  So either we'll have the archive there, or on my website, or maybe both.  But there will be a group home for us, nicer than this one, with or without a direct archive.


I suppose if the group dies out, because of the move, I won't need to renew the group next year.  If it thrives, I think it won't be too hard to raise (or appeal for donation of) $220 from group members.  I have some stuff I could sell. :-)


So please hang out here and wait for an invitation to the new group.  It should go to the address you're using here.  Once the transfer is finished, I think you'll be able to use any old e-mail you want, over there.


Thanks!
